learning_outcomes.description: Understand some key philosophical concepts and identify the major ideas in Kant.
Demonstrate effective communication skills in the contexts of group discussion and essay writing.
Demonstrate a capacity for independent and creative thought.
Use critical judgment to solve philosophical problems and issues.
Engage ethically with ideas and experiences beyond their own immediate social and personal context.

assessments.task_description:
Tutorials commence in the second week of semester and are compulsory for the course. Students should participate in the 10 tutorials in order to be eligible to receive full marks for this component (10%). Weekly reading for the tutorials is required. 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted us of Generative AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
First essay questions cover the topics from weeks 1-6. Students are expected to answer only ONE of these questions for the essay. Word length is 1600 words.

This assessment task evaluates student’s abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit your essay via Turn-in-it on the class site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment piece is a short 400 word discussion of Kant's transcendental aesthetic.

This assessment task evaluates student’s abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via Turn-it-in on the course site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This essay is based on material from weeks 7-13; you will answer only one question for the essay. Word length is 1400 words.

This assessment task evaluates student’s abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the link on Turn-it-in on the Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 12(10 Mar - 25 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

Tutorials are closely tied to lecture material and are designed to allow students to focus on relevant themes. Weekly required readings allow close and careful analysis of emerging themes. Tutorials commence in the second week of semester and are compulsory for the course. Students will receive a combined participation mark based on regular submitted reflections: 10% There are ten tutorials during the semester.
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorials Tutorials are closely tied to lecture material and are designed to allow students to focus on relevant themes. Weekly required readings allow close and careful analysis of emerging themes. Tutorials commence in the second week of semester and are compulsory for the course. Students will receive a combined participation mark based on regular submitted reflections: 10% There are ten tutorials during the semester.
